title: Is it okay to be so positive that you call 2020 a good year despite its harsh realities? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, certain political entities did completely expose their various agendas, so that’s a good thing. They also indicated they are (thankfully) incompetent, so there’s that. I’ll be glad when November is over since I’m pretty sure this year from March through today has been all about getting rid of Trump and/or non-RINO U.S. Republican party members. January and February 2020 were pretty good, and after November the remainder of the year should let us know what 2021 will be like. I think it will be a great year compared to 2020, but who knows. I invested in the stock market recently based on a tip I received from AOC. She tried to have a company investigated. Thus, anything a communist does not like is probably a sure thing to succeed.

Sure. It can be a good year for you individually, even if it was a bad year in other ways for other people. For me, 2020 was OK. I didn’t buy into the coronavirus panic, plus I’m a “prepper” so I was already ready for the shortages. I lost some income due to the government’s misguided shutdowns, but I’m not starving. People I know caught Covid-19 and recovered just fine. Someone in my household has the virus right now, so I have been marinating in the virus for a week now. Even so, not a bad year. This year has certainly been better for me than 2015 was (my older daughter was killed in a car wreck that year), and no one would feel guilty about saying 2015 was a good year for them personally, even though it wasn’t good for me. Your experience of the year is subjective. Don’t feel bad if 2020 was a good year for you. Be glad about it.
